Name: Radhika Narasimhan
Title: Prayer at Marundeeshwarar temple
Review: One of the oldest temple of Chennai where the belief followed is, those who visit are cured of diseases. Today morning via adyar from the back entrance I entered the temple. Had good darshan of the legend and consort Tripurasundari Devi. Atmosphere was calm filled with lovely nature and spirituality. A must visit temple of chennai.

Name: niluanu
Title: Serene Temple
Review: Located in the Thiruvanmiyur area of Chennai, this is a very old Shiva temple dating back to the Chola period. A serene and spacious temple, it attracts a lot of devotees and is easily accessible. The temple complex also houses shrines of Ganesha, Kartik and Parvati. The temple is open from 5.30 in the morning till noon, and again from 4.30pm till 9.30pm

Name: Sud D
Title: One of the oldest temples in Chennai
Review: Paadal Petra Sthalam. One off the oldest Shiva temples in Chennai. Nice temple to visit. A lot of legends and history

Name: Devika Rani
Title: Siva devotees, answers prayers for the sick
Review: The lord siva here is known as Marundeerswara.  Devotees in ancient days believed that visiting places blessed by sages or created with a purpose  relieves certain pains and diseases.   The temple is accessible by road from Adyar.    .  A great place to spend 2-3 hours in the morning understanding the history of the temple.   This one answers the devotees.   Professionals like doctors may think religion and practices ignore them but sometimes even for a medicine to work we need some divine guidance. A miracle experience for me and hope it helps the devotees who read this .

Name: Nagarjuna
Title: Lord's blessings on MAHASHIVRATRI
Review: Great old templeGreat darshan of lord shiva and ammanGreat organization by temple volunteers.Disciplined devotees.Very easy to locateExcellent transportation facilities by mtc buses.Temple AUTHORITIES should run book stall which sells books in regional languages about temple and it's historyOM NAMA SHIVAYA

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: One of the twin temples of Thirukkachur
Review: The temple is 7th century temple dedicated to lord shiva worshipped as marundeeswarar and goddess Parvathi as irulneeki thayar. This along with the kachabeswarar temple of the Thirukkachur village is considered as twin temple of the village.

Name: Mrudula
Title: Lord Shiva
Review: This is the temple where lord shiva is worshiped and people believe that the god here is very powerful and can clear any disease upon visit

Name: sridharan2013
Title: An ancient temple in Chennai
Review: This temple located in the famous Mylapore area of Chennai is ancient with lots of history. Lord Kapaleeswara and Goddess karpagambal are the main deities in the temple. Temple has a huge area with mandapams for devotees to sit and relax/meditate. The temple has its own large temple pond. It is a divine experience visiting the temple and having Dharshan of Lord and the goddess.

Name: Gosthala
Title: A divine place for cure
Review: Marundeeswarar temple located at Tiruvanmiyur, Chennai is a Paadal Petra Sthalam since it has been mentioned in the classic tamil works by the Nayanars during 6th to 9th century CE. There is a belief that it is at this place that Lord Shiva imparted sage Agasthya about the knowledge of medicinal value of various herbs that relieve people from illness and diseases. Hence people visit the temple to get relieved from their ailments or pray for the cure of their kith and kin.People perform milk abhishekam to the Lord and consume Vibuthi to get cured of illness and relief from sins. When the wishes are fulfilled, they offer vastras to God.One could feel a difference within oneself on entering the temple and witnessing the Lord at the sanctum sanctorum.

Name: Karikalan S
Title: Hindu Temple, ancient and a holy place
Review: An ancient and holy place. Well maintained and well illustrated. People with hindu faith will relish every moment being here.

Name: reubenranjanfern2017
Title: Very old holy temple.
Review: This temple has a lot to do with history and culture. Very well maintained. Offered my prayer and ask other to visit this place.

Name: TravellingSands
Title: Self Manifested Shiv Ling!! 1300 Years of documented history
Review: This temple is where Lord Shiva is believed to have taught Herbal Medicine to Sage Agasthya. The Shiva Lingam here is a self-manifested one and is white in colour. Moreover, the Lingam has traditionally been kept 'untouched' even by the priests. The milk 'abhishekam' (showers) performed around 8. 15 pm daily before the last Puja is not to be missed. That is when the hymns by a realized Yogi (Sidh) sage 'Sivavakkiar' are chanted in unison by the large gathering of devotees which makes it a hair raising experience. The timings of this ritual are changed during festival days.

Name: Ananth 727499
Title: One of the padal Petra sthalangal of Lord Shiva..
Review: The main deity of this Temple is Lord Shiva - called as Marundeeswarar (god to cure all diseases) Ambal - Thiripura Sundari Amman There are 05 holy theertham For this Temple.. They are01. Janma Nasini 02. Kama Nasini 03. Papa Nasini 04. Gyana Dhayini05. MOKSHA Nasini Speciality-The Shiva lingam worshipped in this temple is a Swayambumurthi and it is white in colour.This lingam is not touched by human hands, not even by the priests, as it is “Theendathirumeni”.Sage Valmiki worshipped Lord Shiva here, the lord here is called as “Vanmeeki Nathar”. Sage Agasthiyar worshipped Lord Shiva in this Temple. He was taught the details and using the medicinal herbs (Oushadha Muligai) by lord Shiva.

Name: c krishnan
Title: Evening visit in May 2019
Review: I visited this temple after a gap of two years and felt that such an ancient temple could be maintained better. It obviously needs funds for better upkeep. The surroundings of the temple are also very crowded but that seems to be the phenomenon with major temples in Tamilnadu. Notwithstanding, this temple is well worth a visit for its architecture and general atmosphere.

Name: vijmail99
Title: Excellent temple
Review: Divine, peaceful and well maintained temple. Located near the bus stand and easily accessible. Don't miss this temple

Name: Narasimhan G
Title: Very inspiring Temple
Review: Devotion multiplies here since  Lord Shiva  himself is medicine for physical as well as mental and Spiritual lives..Easily reachable , situated in the busy ECR road , very near to Thiruvanmiyur Bus stand

Name: AKTHAKUR
Title: PEOPLE WITH ILLNESS PLEASE VISIT THIS TEMPLE
Review: This temple is visited by people mainly with various kinds of illness and there is a belief that illnesses are a punishment for karma and sins for past birth as well as present.So devotees from all parts of India Sri Lanka Malaysia Indonesia Thailand visit this temple to pray before Lord Shiva for their recovery from such illness.The architecture is very ancient. Neat and clean and there are shops outside the temple for buying offerings.Must visit. Timings are  05.30 AM to 12.00 Noon and 04.00 PM to 08.30 PM...Address - Sri Marundeeswarar TempleLalitha NagarThiruvanmiyurChennai,Tamil Nadu – 600 041.Tele: 044 - 2441 0477, 044 - 2442 2688.

Name: Bala M
Title: Old Temple worth a visit
Review: Nice temple for a relaxing atmosphere with family.  the trees, the walk ways, very peaceful atmosphere - worth a visit even if you are an atheist.

Name: Rajesh S
Title: Highly spiritual place, feel the difference
Review: Its a very famous and one of the olden temple build by chola empire. Lord shiva is the main god and thirupurasundari amman and thyagaraya swami temples are also inside. Very good place to visit with family. Good space for car parking behind the temple well is there, hot of the city, bus connectivity, other modes or transport like auto , rental cars can be easily available at door step. Must visit once though you are other parts of chennai. Its one of the 274 siva temples in the south. Good for ppl suffer with long term diseases as the name says Marundheeswarar (Medicine). Believe, let live. Om Namasivaya

Name: Sridhar K
Title: Very ancient temple; maintained beatifully
Review: A very ancient temple of Lord Shiva located at the Northern end of East Coast Road.  It has got separate sanctums for Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvathi.  Sage Valmiki is said to have visited this temple and also sung praises of the Lord here.  There is parking too for those traveling by car or two wheeler.

Name: Venkataraman R
Title: Ancient peaceful temple in Chennai City
Review: A temple which was visited by great shaivite saints like Appar(Thirunavukkarasar), Thirungnanasambandar (Sambandar) and has associations with great saints like Valmiki, Agasthiar and was visited by Arunagirinathar(famous muruga devotee saint)  being situated in Chennai city, is really heartening. This temple is very peaceful and well maintained and has got good parking as well in front of the temple. We had good darshan of Shiva (Marundeeswarar) & Ambal (Thiripurasundari) and darshan of Vinayagar and Murugan (visited by Saint Arunagiri) and had pleasant circambulations around the temple. Very peaceful temple to visit and feel the vibes. Very good place for doing mediations as well.

Name: yy m
Title: Ancient temple
Review: Ancient temple where Siva had given darshan to both sages valmiki and agastiar near the sthala viruksham which is vanni maram . Thiru marindeeswarar and thiru purasundari bless the devotees. Some devotees were singing excellent siva hymn in Tamil( unknown to me)  and lots others were “hands on deck” in preparation for the Anna abishegam and Anna danam due to happen later today got pournami.The tank inside the temple has such huge fishes .

Name: Priya M
Title: Old Temple
Review: Its one of the old temple in chennai city. its not that well maintained but still good place to pray in peace.

Name: nageswararao g
Title: Good clean temple complex
Review: Its a good clean temple complex situation near to the coast. Siva devotees and all other devotees visit this place for inner peace.

Name: Traveloney
Title: Very neatly maintained
Review: I had been here for a marriage on my first time visit. It is such a vast space with very well maintained temple area.

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Good Temple
Review: This is a very nice temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Situated at Thiruvanmiyur, this  temple has a very peaceful ambiance. Lots of religious activities are conducted here.

Name: siva200
Title: A must visit temple of Lord Shiva
Review: Its a must visit temple of Lord Shiva. Located in thiruvanmiyur, it has prime god - Marundeeswarar and Goddess thiripura sundari.It has a vanni tree where its been written that Lord Shiva appeared twice.Its a great place to spend some peaceful time.

Name: kalpalatha
Title: The old beautiful temple
Review: Been visiting this temple for the past 50 years.. its silent.. divine and wonderful.. Me and my son would worship and then sit in the praharam made of stones enjoying the slight heat which is eminated from it and forget the world.. its a beautiful time that i share with my son

Name: vasan224
Title: powerful god
Review: marudheeswarar temple in thiruvanmiyur is famous temple were the god will fullfil the people wishes in a very successful manner.

Name: Chaitanya Nagen... K
Title: Awesome Abhishekam
Review: We all know that , Lord Shiva likes Abhishekam, here I was very much satisfied with Abhishekam, it starts at 10:30am daily, people need to pour cow milk in one big bowl, which is used for Abhishekam. Bhilva leaves are also available at outside shops. I was very much happy when they used my bhilva leaves to decorate Lord Shiva.

Name: Pradeep Kumar R
Title: Temple visit with my Family
Review: Calm and nice place to visit for acquiring positive energy. Parking facility is available but open parking.

Name: Radhika Narasimhan
Title: Wonderful temple
Review: A temple dedicated to Lord shiva, located in Tiruvanmayur chennai, it is one of the 275 paadal Petra sthalams, whereby the temple was built during the 7th - 8th century. It was widely expanded by the chozha kings, in the 11th century. There are 2 entrances for the temple. There is a belief that, sage Valmiki, who wrote Ramayana, seeked blessings from Lord Shiva, in this temple. Sage Agastiyar, who is popular in curing diseases, has come to this temple and seeked blessings from Lord shiva. A huge temple in the beginning of Tiruvanmayur, that offers peace. I visited the temple three weeks before, that too early in the morning, I found lot of calmness and cool breeze, flow in me. There is a mention about this temple in Tevaram. A must see temple in chennai, that offers the best peace within.

Name: asokanma
Title: A historic Spiritual place.
Review: I am blessed to visit the place on 23-Mar-18 during Annual "Panguni" Festival and feel the holiness of the deities:Siva and Amman. You can have your copy of the History of the temple from the office ticket counter, which is complied by Thru Adiyaman who writes regularly in the famous 'The Daily Thanthi' tamil newspaper about Indian and foreign Hindu temples. This is the starting point of famous ECR which connects Chennai with southern Tamilnadu by road through Mahabalipuram Pondy etc

Name: Umang A
Title: Shiva temple..
Review: Old Shiva temple located at the beginning of East Coast road and nearby to other key attraction points.

Name: Prasad B
Title: Space for spirituality with a monumental touch !!
Review: The place cum heritage dedicated to Lord Siva is not only highly ancient but also preserved with a touch of conservation...Prefer to visit in evening.

Name: meghashyam
Title: Lord who bestows good health
Review: On the beginning of ECR , very ancient lord Shiva temple , lord and maa are highly benevolent , Sri Sai Baba temple is nearby .

Name: akhilchandu
Title: Must visit
Review: This temple name secrecy is known as Marundeeswarar, Marund(medicine)+eswarar(giver) that implies that the god present here ie; lord shiva is the medicine giver and the visitors or people who come to this temple with any illness or any negative will get medicine when they had the "Vibhuti on their body". And so this all depends on the belief only. This temple is located very near in the city, easily accessible from the city corner to this temple. The special time to visit this temple is during the time of "Mahashivratri", at this time the god will be decorated beautifully and special attractions like "Shiva dance, shows, dramas will be conducted here at this time". So don't miss this temple when visited to Chennai.

Name: Jayasiva
Title: West facing lord Shiva and south facing Amman
Review: Its very very old temple near by our home, here you see West facing lord Shiva and south facing Tiripura Sundari Amman. If you have more time, go around mulavar as much as possible since many herb things are there.. There is no Navagraha in this templePuliyodhara prasadam is good.

Name: Sugu_thegreat
Title: Medicine God
Review: Please visit this temple at least you will get confident that your illness will be moving away. Yes the god here is known to cure illness and you will find here in this temple

Name: YatriForever
Title: Deepawali prayers at the temple.
Review: The temple was buzzing with devotees on the auspicious day of Deepawali, it was such a wonderful darshan of the Lord Marundeeswarar, Ambal , Lord Ganesha and Murugan. The temple does allow foreigners, photography is permitted on most areas except the sanctum.

Name: Sridhar P
Title: Temple with Power
Review: Excellent and a very old temple. Well maintained and following the rituals even today.You can see the best vulva tree.Please visit the temple around 7.30 to 7.45 pm so that you can participate in the last arathi. Even today they follow the rituals perfectly without any change.Heard this is one of the most powerful Shiva temple...

Name: Padcee
Title: One more temple to visit
Review: If you happen to be in Thiruvanmiyur area and have some time to spare, do visit this temeple. It is asusal a simple Shiva temple with more than 1000 years of history.

Name: AnilkumarAnandan
Title: Ancient temple for Lord shiva
Review: must see if you happen to cross thiruvanmiyur. its closely located to the bus stand. plan for a evening with family & kids. do worship and stay blessed.

Name: tnbalaji90
Title: Oldest temple
Review: One among the oldest temples in Chennai, close to Tiruvanmiyur bys terminus.Crowded during week ends and other auspicious days. Neatly maintained . Visit the temple and get the blessings.

Name: Sridhar
Title: GREAT TEMPLE
Review: One among the oldest temples in Chennai, close to Tiruvanmiyur bus  terminus.Crowded during week ends and other auspicious days. Neatly maintained . Visit the temple and get the blessings.

Name: Venkata Shivaku... R
Title: Visit twice
Review: The first visit should just be to get to know the temple and its activities better. If you have a family, take them with you on the first visit itself - they will enjoy the experience. There are lots of sevas and it would be worthwhile to book one of them; this is one of major locations for Goddess Tripurasundari in Chennai. If visiting as a couple, book an abhishekam for both the Lord and the Goddess; it will solve many of your marital problems. In my opinion, a must visit for newly married couples.

Name: bhumuthu
Title: Very divine place to worship
Review: It s situated in ECR road, Thiruvanmiyur, chennai.valmiki worshipped shiva here ,and so called vanmiyur.5 mins walkable from thiruvanmiyur bus depo.separate car and two wheeler parking available.Huge tank is in front of temple. Lord Marundeeswarar and Ambal thiruparasundari. Marundeeswarar means lord will cure all our diseases. Lord Shiva blessed sage agasthya with knowledge of herbs and Medicinal  plants, so named marundeeswarar . sannathi for vinayaga, Murugan,thiagaraja,Kala bairavar. Durgai, dakshinamoorthy, natarajar,etc.sthala vrikcham is Vanni tree.worship on pradosam day s very special here ,nayanmars visited and sang poems here.panguni festival and shivaratri festival is conducted.kamadhenu poured milk on linga during chola period.Temple timings from 6 am to 12 noon and from 4 pm to 9 pm

Name: Harvey
Title: Amazing temple - well worth a visit
Review: I do visit Marundeeswarar temple from time to time and love the spiritual experience. The main sanctum sanctorium, a few hundred years old, is serene. It is well worth a visit and is one of Chennai's hidden gems.

Name: Saravanan2014
Title: Ancient Temple
Review: Small but beautiful ancient temple near sea shore of thiruvanmiyur. Shiva parvathy marriage darshan was given by Lord shiva in this temple to sage Agasthiya as Agasthiar was not able to attend marriage Shiva Parvathy Marriage at Kailash. Must visit temple @ Chennai

Name: WayfarerIndia
Title: Beautiful temple with a long history
Review: Marandeeshwara temple is a Shiva temple with a long history, Valmiki is said to have prayed to Lord Shiva here before he wrote the Ramayana. This temple has been referred in Tamil literature and has references from the 7th century. Beautifully built on a large scale its like a serene oasis on the now bustling ECR.

Name: Yogesh Gupta
Title: Lord of Medicines
Review: Shiva temple, in Thiruvanmiyur. Marundhu in Tamil means Medicine. Old Temple with rich history. Must visit place.

Name: krazikams
Title: Traffic woes
Review: To just enter the temple, you may have to make your way through dense traffic of Buses, Share Autos and vendors. Very old temple in Thiruvanmiyur area, frequented by neighborhood people. Gets crowded on weekends and festive occasions,.

Name: Iratdog
Title: Hindu experience
Review: I visited this Temple recently. It's obviously a relic. Some of the shrines made of cut stone are quite obviously antique. The main towers and statuary are very well preserved. You get the best of both worlds. There is less of a drive to pressure you to donate than others. You do need to purchase a camera pass unless you don't take pictures. If you get stopped by a curator they don't say you need a pass, they say no pictures. Producing the pass improves the experience. You still can't shoot the actual Deities.

Name: mrvradhika
Title: Ancient Shiva temple
Review: Very old shiva temple. The temple has a sacred tree too apart from the idols such as Lord Vishnu,Lakshmi,Surya and there is a legend about the tree saying that Lord Shiva actually appeared there. Must see temple in chennai.

Name: Kashyap V
Title: Ancient Hindu Temple
Review: Ancient Temple of Siva. It was originally built in 7th Century I believe and later renovated in 11th Century. Here Lord Siva  is considers as the God of Medicine. It's believed that people with any kind of disease, once prayed here will be cure of their diseases.

Name: mukund s
Title: Calm, and powerful
Review: Unkown to may people outside chennai, marundeeswarar temple is quite a calm place for a evening visit. The temple is known to be powerful for the deity himself named as marundeeswarar, "Marundu" meaning medicine.  It is one of the 275 Paadal Petra Sthalams, where the three of the most revered Nayanars (Saivite Saints), Appar and Tirugnana Sambandar have glorified the temple with their verses during the 7th-8th century. The Marundeeswarar temple has been a place of curative worship for people with diseases.

Name: suseelasukumar
Title: Divine temple
Review: We went to this temple one evening. We had darshan of all sannidhis.All priest r very kind and told about the temples.

Name: Lakshmi Narayanan S
Title: God who heals all your diseases
Review: This temple is located in Tiruvanmaiyur, Chennai. This is an ancient temple. Lord Siva is the presiding deity. Lord Shiva here is believed to heal the diseases of one who prays with devotion. It's a very peaceful temple in Chennai city. Easily accessible by public and private transport.

Name: Gopinath T
Title: Weekly visit
Review: Very peaceful temple. Main god is Shiva. Here we can see both Shiva and lord venkatesh in same place

Name: babuvis51
Title: God who cures all illness
Review: This temple is situated in Tiruvanmiyur at the beginning of East Coast Road. A serene and a peaceful temple. It is believed that the presiding deity Marundeeswarar (Lord Shiva) will cure all illness if offered prayers.

Name: lakshmikandappan
Title: temple of lord shiva
Review: this is a temple dedicated to lord shiva.this is located near the thiruvanmiyur bus stand and is on the very road so one may never miss this while moving towards mamallapuram or pondy.the shivalingam is believed to have a healing effect and is quiet popular.the temple maintains a goshala a home for the cows.

Name: raja p
Title: popular temple for cure of health diseases.
Review: this is popular place of worship for people with diseases and various problems with their health.i went to this temple in the evening.

Name: Krishna Kumar S
Title: History ! spend at least 1-2 hours in this holy temple
Review: this is very much within the city (southern side of the city). Plenty of local transport (auto, bus, call taxis). This is one of the 'Paadal petra sthalam' of Lord Shiva and the history goes back to more than 1000 years. This a very big temple and there are discourses everyday in the evening. This is one of those few temples where Lord Shiva is facing the west (other places he faces the east side). There is a nice "Go-Shaala" (Cow Shed) inside the temple. Visit this temple with lot of time and explore the vast temple.

Name: big_travelfreak
Title: Divine
Review: I had been to this temple many a times and everytime I feel serene. A standout architecture. And their temple prasadhams - too good. Its quite calm although its just too close to thiruvanmiyur main road. Must visit place.

Name: venkatesh k
Title: Divine, peaceful place to visit
Review: Situated very close to the thiruvanmiyur bus stand on the start of ECR road, this shiva temple is yet another architectural master piece.  Ample space inside the temple.  Concerts, dance programs organized on special days.  Environment inside the temple is very peaceful.  Worth a visit.

Name: PerWilson
Title: Best Temple in Chennai
Review: Visited this temple during a business trip. It was very busy but a Unique experience. Do not leave shoes outside but instead try the safehouse left of the main entrance. Non-hindus are not allowed inside the Centre main part, but that still leaves enough to experience.

Name: Prabhu P
Title: Must Visit Temple in Chennai
Review: Located near the Thiruvanmiyur Bus depot, one of the important temples of Lord Shiva. The Gopuram looks beautiful at the night with the lights. Majesty & beauty !

Name: Sudhar23
Title: Goodwill temple lord shiva facing west direction
Review: Visited on birthday Special temple having main deity facing western directionRecommended for entrance through the temple pool sideBcoz the entrance on the main road is actually the rear oneDon't miss the 3vinayaga shrine inside

Name: sMahendrakumar
Title: Historical holy place
Review: Oldest temple which was built around 8th century. This temple was famous for people's who were suffering from diseases in olden days. Worth for art lovers. Awesome construction

Name: balmaa v
Title: ancient shiva temple
Review: a great Shiva temple with beautiful surroundings with great architecture of the Siva temples. A must visit for any tourist or Sivan devotee.

Name: KSDVijay
Title: Marundeeswarar Temple - Devine
Review: The Temple is situated in Thiruvanmaiyur near the Bus Depot. The Temple has 2 Temple Tanks in it. Lord Shiva is the main Deity. Special puja is performed on Sunday @ 4.30 PM for Sharabeshwar. I also recommend people to visit Valmikinaathar Jeeva Swamithi which is near the Temple on the ECR Road.

Name: 550anupb
Title: Tranquil, peaceful temple in the heart of Thiruvanmiyur
Review: I have been to this temple several times. It is quite old and the architectural beauty is reason enough to visit. plus, the temple atmosphere is quite peaceful and tranquil, despite being in the very heart of Thiruvanmiyur, and situated right on the bustling main road. During festivals/ auspicious occasions, however, the crowds tend to be overwhelming, and parking is a problem.

Name: ArunaSrinivas
Title: Old and historical temple
Review: It is a beautiful temple of Lord Shiva easily accessible from the Thiruvanmiyur Bus Stand and Vegetable Market. It is one of the big, oldest and temples in the city. Various people perform dance and sloka recitals in the temple premises. Dont miss their tasty prasadams :)

Name: Govindarao K
Title: Unique Shiva Temple near Sea shore Chennai Tamilnadu India
Review: Marundeeswarar Temple is one of the oldest shiva temples of South India. It is located a little away from the Sea shore, at Thiruvanmiyur. It is the beginning of East Coast Road,  ( ECR ) ending at Puducherry ( old name Pondicherry ). The place is well connected by bus and also train ( Chennai Beach station - Velacherry route ).Long back, it was the end of the south Chennai, but now with expansion taking at ECR,the place has gained much importance. The temple is quite large and there are festivals through out the year.The temple is maintained neatly and during festival times, dance / dramas are conducted. A good safe place, calm and away from the mad crowd, when compared to  other places of worship.

Name: Senthil K
Title: Great temple
Review: great place to get peace and love, nice location  its historic place must visit place in  chennai ,  on the ECR close to bus stand, great healing powers on this temple not much crowed nice time with children and family

Name: Kiruthikapalanisamy
Title: Historical
Review: This place have a lot of history to it so huge and not crowded on normal days best for old age people and also their prasadhams are worth visiting for ;)

Name: Mona D
Title: Sacred temple
Review: Heard about this temple's healing powers. We visited on a sunday but it was not too crowded maybe because it is not in the city centre and not during a festival. Nevertheless we had a peaceful and good darshan. Beautiful ancient structure and sivalingam, rich in history as many have offered prayers here before. You can feel a certain calming presence once entering the temple. A must visit temple for all devotees.

Name: Karthik R
Title: Old temple carrying lots of beliefs
Review: An old temple for Lord Shiva - just opposite to the Tiruvanmiyur bus stand. This temple is known for solving age old health related problems when devotees offer prayers regularly at the temple.The temple is quite mid in size and carries a positive vibration as one does prayers whole heartedly. There is a Go-shala - Cow shed where people offer greens and regular sanctums for Lord Muruga, Lord Vinayaka and many more.There is prasadham stall inside. Parking is available on the front side of the temple as well as on ECR road side. It takes less than 1 hour if no crowd and may be 1-2 hours if there is crowd. There is free dharshan and fee dharshan - for Rs.25.

Name: Shankar S
Title: Powerful Temple has Medicinal value
Review: Temple located at middle of Thiruvanmayur Chennai. Spacious and well maintained. Last month March 2016 temple had kumbabeeshgam.Linga is of very small in size covered with silver or gold (depends up on occasion ).Best time during opening and closing.Named after Marundu(medicine) + eeswar (siva) says which can vibrant to cure disease.Temple renovated recently and maintained, better not to complaint on ambience than to feel the vibration by sitting in front of linga for 10 mins.

Name: PTG1976
Title: Marundeeswar temple
Review: This is a very beautiful, large temple in the center of Tiruvanmiyur, which is in the southern par of Chennai, on E.C.R. (East Coast Road) which leads to Mamallapuram or Mahabalipuram, the great tourist attraction. The main deity, Lord Shiva is called the Marundeeshwar (Lord of medicines). There are sanctum-sanctoriums for the Ambal, Bhairavar etc. Kept very neat & tidy, poojas are performed well here.

Name: Ranga R
Title: A very good trip which was spiritually very satisfactory
Review: A great temple dedicated to Siva  wonderful architecture, very clean surroundings and a very helpful priest. The sanctums of Lod Marundeeswarar and  Devi Tripursaundari are bright and the murthis are very visibleThe temple is also very easily accessible being very close to the Tiruvanmiyur Bus stand

Name: TonyVakakis
Title: Love the archtecture
Review: Amazing temples pop up in all of the places we visited. Imposing and a must. Nooks and crannies everywhere reveal sculpted works of art

Name: vijisekaran
Title: Temple visit
Review: The main deity is Lord Shiva in the marundhu (Medicine) + eendavar(Giver)=marundeeswarar(Medicine giver). The main idea is  if you go to have darshan of Lord Shiva here in this temple and if you have any ailment and take that vibhudhi , you will get cured. It all depends on your prayer and belief.

Name: David B
Title: Relaxing
Review: It was great to walk along the roadside and on to the beach.  At one end is the Triumph of Labour statue.  At the other end the Gandhi statue.  The main concourse has a range of interesting buildings on one side and a sandy beach overlooking the Bay of Bengal on the other side.  About 2 miles long!

Name: vpas
Title: An ancient temple
Review: This is a very ancient temple with a Swayambu Lingam , the main deity of Shiva is not one that was made, it was found there. There are shrines for His consort and sons too. A very peaceful atmosphere. They also have cows in the premises. It is a fairly big temple and an interesting one. Books on the origin of the temple are available for purchase.

Name: RajthilakS
Title: One of the peaceful big temple in south Chennai.
Review: Marundeeswarar temple is in east coast road in Tiruvanmiyur, Chennai. The temple is big but not crowded like many other bigger temples. So it mostly becomes peaceful place for worshipping. Junt next to Tiruvanmiyur bus stand makes it easily accesible.

Name: sand_misc
Title: huge temple, divine
Review: Very near Thiruvanmiyur Bus stand, hugeee temple, they have lots of place to sit and meditate or just pray.. It can get really crowded on pradosham and sivarathri days.. they have car parking facilities outside the front entrance of the temple.. they have a pond near the temple too... The God is known is known for his healing powers...

Name: fwaffarn
Title: Classical Sosuth Indian temple scenes
Review: The temple has the classical hindu dieties.  interesting shops in immediate temple vicinity. Crowded and bustling courtyard.

Name: Viswaconsultant
Title: You can spot your Star Lingams..
Review: Very old temple..Your Wish about any physical problems will be solved by worshipping Lord Shiva..Thirubura Sundary  Amman (Goodess Parvathy ) is also very powerful.. Visit once and get the feelings of the power..

Name: KWDavey
Title: A pleasant surprise
Review: We visited this temple at 4pm and were humbly surprised to be invited inside to experience the rituals carried out in the temple.  All of the people were so welcoming and we had a guide who explained to us about the Hindu religion. We felt very privileged to be able to visit this site

Name: Swami1939
Title: THE DIVINE EXPERIENCE
Review: The Marundeeswarar Temple in Tiruvanmiyur is one of the ancient Siva temples in Chennai City. The Main Daitee - MARUNDEESWARAR is considered to be the God of healing. The Divine atmosphere is well suited for a worry free meditation. The GOSALA ( Place where cows are maintained) is worth mentioning. The THIRUPURA SUNDARI AMMAN in side the main temple is very famous which attract large number of devotees every day. The Temple has a gate open on the East Coast Road for easy entry of those commuting of this busy road.

Name: Chuck012
Title: The oldest temple in chennai
Review: This temple was built in the 7th century still is a place where the Shaivaites get together in large number and make the place reverberatingly energetic across seasons. Visit this temple atleast 4 times a week. Magnificent, epicentre of a loosing culture of ppl.

Name: Myo M
Title: Two front gates! :)
Review: What sets this temple apart from all other Hindu temples in the city is its two successive (as in a "column" going into the temple grounds if you view from outside) front gates, whereas there's only one front gate at all the other temples I got to.  And I don't know if the reason for the two front gates is because of the two tomb (shrine) buildings on the temple grounds inside, maybe there are two deities of "equal significance" here (with a tomb building for each of the two) and therefore two front gates (one for each of the two), but as a non-Hindu that's only my "thought" as to the reason for the two front gates.  The passageway between the two gates is also fairly wide (not a narrow passageway) with paintings on the ceiling and carvings on the pillars, so I figured it was the Marriage Hall since all big Hindu temples seem to have got one of those (I'm quite sure a Marriage Hall is an essential part of a Hindu temple).  Also, on the right side of the back area of the temple grounds is a tree with a little fence around it, and I saw some people circling around it likely for some religious reason.There's no admission fee here, but similar to Kapaleeswarar (Chennai's most famous temple) further north, there's a "photo fee" here as well; I paid 50 rupees for it.By public transportation, the nearest bus depot is Thiruvanmiyur (1A & A1 buses get there that I know of, but I'm sure there are many others too since it's a fairly big station), and it's a short walk south from there to the Temple.

Name: Portel B
Title: Near Beach
Review: This temple located near beach you need get taxi for the temple visit taxi they will charge you around Rs.300 call taxi ola ntl call taxi

Name: RamGanesan
Title: An age old temple
Review: If I were to suggest two Shiva temples in the southern side of Chennai it would be Kabali temple at Mylapore and this temple.  This place has been work shipped by several saints and the presiding deity is know for showering blessing for those suffering from disease and hence the name.  Over the years the maintenance of the temple has seen great improvement. Being a local of that area, I have always been fascinated by the last pooja (Arthajama Pooja) at the temple.  I would recommend this to anyone who wants a peaceful darshan.

Name: sundarjagalan
Title: Very old shivan temple
Review: This temple is very near to thriuvanmiyur temple. One of the oldest temple in Chennai. Visit this place early morning or late evening.. it is really a worth to visit en-route to pondicherry

Name: ulag63
Title: Shiv Shiv
Review: This is one of the very old Siva temple and we use to visit very often. Lord Siva is an powerful god and our prayers will be fulfilled always by Lord Siva. Om Nama Chivaya.

Name: veerananjundan
Title: Namashivaya omm..
Review: It is an awesome feeling. i loved it. i like very much lord shiva. this temple gives all in my life.. when i was in chennai.. everyday i used to.. i like that night puja (PALLIARAI PUJAI).. Namashivaya ommm.. Namashivaya ommm.. Namashivaya ommm.. Namashivaya ommm..

Name: Narayanan R
Title: Must visit Shiva temple
Review: Very sacred and powerful Shiva temple.. the place is calm and ideal for religious devotion. if you are in thiruvanmiyur this is a must visit place.. The power of this place is a must experience.. preferable time for visit is during the evening aarthi..  the aarthi is very good to be part of..

Name: Sivaram S
Title: Very beautiful and calm
Review: This temple is just at the beginning of the east coast road, the entertainment hub of Chennai. The entrance from the ECR road may looks simple, however the other entrance is so beautiful and pious. However busy the external surroundings, immediately after entering the temple, you will feel the calmness in your heart and the blessings of Lord Shiva. Within the city reach, less of modernization, pious atmosphere would definitely brings you peace and calm one needs in life. Visit there and get good health with Lord Shiva's blessings.
